intro: Dracophyllum macranthum, commonly known as the large-flowered dracophyllum, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
